Welcome to GoIT-RestAPI’s documentation!¶

GoIT-RestAPI main¶

main.read_root()¶
The read_root function returns a dictionary with the key &quot;message&quot; and value

&quot;Hi! Welcome to the address book!

Returns:

A dictionary with a message key

Doc-author:

Trelent

async main.startup()¶

The startup function is called when the application starts up. It’s a good place to initialize things that are needed by your app, such as database connections or caches.

Returns:

A coroutine

Doc-author:

Trelent

GoIT-RestAPI repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactModel, db: Session, user: User) → Contact¶

The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactModel: Deserialize the request body into a contactmodel object

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Get the user id from the token

Returns:

The contact that was created

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_birthday(days_range, db: Session, user: User) → List[Contact]¶
The get_birthday function returns a list of contacts whose birthday is within the specified range.
Args:

days_range (int): The number of days from today to search for birthdays. db (Session): A database session object used to query the database. user (User): The user who owns the contacts being queried.

Parameters:

  • days_range – Determine the range of days to search for birthdays

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Get the user id of the current user

Returns:

A list of contacts that have a birthday in the next n days

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session, user: User) → Contact¶
The get_contact function takes in a contact_id and returns the corresponding Contact object.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the Contact to be retrieved. db (Session): A database session for querying Contacts from the database. user (User): The User who owns this Contact.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact to be retrieved

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Make sure that the user is getting their own contact

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_by_email(email: int, db: Session, user: User) → Contact¶

The get_contact_by_email function takes in an email and a database session, and returns the contact with that email. If no such contact exists, it raises a 404 error.

Parameters:

  • email – int: Filter the database by email

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Get the user’s id from the database

Returns:

A list of contacts with the specified email address

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_by_first_name(first_name: int, db: Session, user: User) → Contact¶

The get_contact_by_first_name function returns a contact by first name.

Parameters:

  • first_name – int: Specify the first name of the contact to be retrieved

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Make sure that the user is only able to get contacts that they have created

Returns:

A list of contacts with the given first name

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_by_last_name(last_name: int, db: Session, user: User) → Contact¶

The get_contact_by_last_name function returns a list of contacts with the given last name.

Parameters:

  • last_name – int: Filter the database query by last name

  • db – Session: Access the database

  • user – User: Check if the user is authorized to access this function

Returns:

A list of contacts with the same last name

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(skip: int, limit: int, db: Session, user: User) → List[Contact]¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts for the user.

Parameters:

  • skip – int: Skip a number of contacts in the database

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • db – Session: Pass in the database session

  • user – User: Get the contacts of a specific user

Returns:

A list of contacts

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session, user: User) → Contact | None¶
The remove_contact function removes a contact from the database.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the contact to be removed. db (Session): A connection to the database. user (User): The user who is removing this contact.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact to be deleted

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Check if the user is authorized to delete a contact

Returns:

A contact object or none

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactModel, db: Session, user: User) → Contact | None¶
The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the contact to update. body (ContactModel): The updated information for the specified contact.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Identify the contact that will be deleted

  • body – ContactModel: Get the data from the request body

  • db – Session: Access the database

  • user – User: Get the user id from the token

Returns:

The updated contact

Doc-author:

Trelent

GoIT-RestAPI repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.change_password(user: User, new_password: str, db: Session) → None¶

The change_password function takes a user and new_password as arguments, and changes the password of the user to new_password.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Specify the user whose password is being changed

  • new_password – str: Pass the new password to the function

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

None, because it does not return anything

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

The confirmed_email function takes in an email and a database session, and sets the confirmed field of the user with that email to True.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Pass in the email address of the user to be confirmed

  • db – Session: Pass in the database session

Returns:

None

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserModel, db: Session) → User¶
The create_user function creates a new user in the database.
Args:

body (UserModel): The UserModel object to be created. db (Session): The SQLAlchemy session object used for querying the database.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Pass the usermodel object to the function

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session) → User¶

The get_user_by_email function takes in an email and a database session, and returns the user associated with that email. If no such user exists, it will return None.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the email of the user we want to get from our database

  • db – Session: Pass in the database session

Returns:

The first user that matches the email address

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_avatar(email, url: str, db: Session) → User¶

The update_avatar function updates the avatar of a user.

Parameters:

  • email – Find the user in the database

  • url – str: Specify the type of data that is being passed into the function

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The updated user

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: Session) → None¶

The update_token function updates the refresh token for a user.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Get the user’s id

  • token – str | None: Pass the token to the function

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

None

Doc-author:

Trelent

GoIT-RestAPI routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.change_password(body: ChangePassword, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The change_password function allows a user to change their password.

The function takes in the current_password and new_password as parameters, and returns a message if the password was successfully changed.

Parameters:

  • body – ChangePassword: Get the email, current_password and new_password from the request

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A dictionary with a message

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The confirmed_email function is used to confirm a user’s email address.

It takes the token from the URL and uses it to get the user’s email address. The function then checks if there is a user with that email in our database, and if not, returns an error message. If there is a user with that email in our database, we check whether their account has already been confirmed or not.

If it has been confirmed already, we return another error message saying so; otherwise we update their account status to &quot;confirmed&quot;.

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the token from the url

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A message to the user

Doc-author:

Trelent

src.routes.auth.generate_password(length: int = 8) → str¶

The generate_password function generates a random password of length 8 characters. The default value for the length parameter is 8, but it can be changed to any integer value. The function returns a string containing the generated password.

Parameters:

length – int: Specify the length of the password

Returns:

A string

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(OAuth2PasswordRequestForm), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The login function is used to authenticate a user.

It takes the email and password of the user as input, checks if they are valid, and returns an access token that can be used for future requests.

Parameters:

  • body – OAuth2PasswordRequestForm: Get the username and password from the request body

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A dict with the access_token and refresh_token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The refresh_token function is used to refresh the access token.

The function takes in a refresh token and returns a new access_token, refresh_token, and the type of token (bearer).

Parameters:

  • credentials – HTTPAuthorizationCredentials: Get the token from the request header

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A dictionary with the access_token, refresh_token and token type

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The request_email function is used to send an email confirmation link to the user’s email address. The function takes in a RequestEmail object, which contains the user’s email address. The function then checks if the user exists and if they have already confirmed their account. If not, it sends them an email with a confirmation link.

Parameters:

  • body – RequestEmail: Get the email from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks

  • request – Request: Get the base_url of the application

  • db – Session: Get a database session

Returns:

A message to the user

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.reset_password(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The reset_password function takes a RequestEmail object as input, which contains an email address. It then checks if the user exists in the database and generates a new password for them. The new password is hashed and stored in the database, replacing their old one. An email containing their new password is sent to them via send_email_reset function.

Parameters:

  • body – RequestEmail: Get the email from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A message that the password was changed and sent to the user’s email

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserModel, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The signup function creates a new user in the database.

It takes a UserModel object as input, which is validated by pydantic. If the email address already exists in the database, an HTTP 409 error is raised. The password field of the UserModel object is hashed using Argon2 and stored in that form to ensure security. A new user record is created with this information and returned to the client.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Pass the user model to the function

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base url of the server

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A dict with the user and a message

Doc-author:

Trelent

GoIT-RestAPI routes Contacts¶

src.routes.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactModel, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

The function takes a ContactModel object as input, which is validated by pydantic. The function also takes an optional db Session object and current_user User object as inputs,

both of which are provided by dependency injection via FastAPI Depends() decorator.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactModel: Define the type of data that will be passed to the function

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • current_user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

A contact model object, which is the same as the body of the function

Doc-author:

Trelent

src.routes.contacts.get_nearest_birthday(days_range: int | None = 7, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_nearest_birthday function returns a list of contacts with birthdays in the next 7 days.

Parameters:

  • days_range – Optional[int]: Specify the number of days to look for birthdays

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • current_user – User: Get the user_id from the token

Returns:

A list of contacts that have a birthday in the next 7 days

Doc-author:

Trelent

src.routes.contacts.read_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The read_contact function is used to read a contact from the database. It takes in an integer representing the ID of the contact, and returns a Contact object.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact id to be updated

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the token

Returns:

The contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

src.routes.contacts.read_contacts(skip: int = 0, limit: int = 100, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The read_contacts function returns a list of contacts.

Parameters:

  • skip – int: Skip a number of contacts

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository function

  • current_user – User: Get the user’s id

Returns:

A list of contacts

Doc-author:

Trelent

src.routes.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The remove_contact function removes a contact from the database.

The function takes in an integer representing the id of the contact to be removed, and returns a Contact object.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact id of the contact we want to update

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository function

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the token

Returns:

The contact that was removed

Doc-author:

Trelent

src.routes.contacts.update_contact(body: ContactModel, contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.
The function takes three arguments:

  • body: A ContactModel object containing the new values for the contact.

  • contact_id: An integer representing the ID of an existing contact to be updated.

  • db (optional): A Session object used to connect to and query a PostgreSQL database, if not provided, one will be created using get_db(). This is done by passing get_db() as an argument into Depends(), which returns a callable that can then be passed into db as its default value. This allows us to use dependency

Parameters:

  • body – ContactModel: Get the contact information from the request body

  • contact_id – int: Identify the contact to be deleted

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the token

Returns:

The updated contact

Doc-author:

Trelent

GoIT-RestAPI routes Users¶

async src.routes.users.read_users_me(current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The read_users_me function is a GET request that returns the current user’s information.

It uses the token_service to get the current user and then returns it.

Parameters:

current_user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

The current user

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.users.update_avatar_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The update_avatar_user function is used to update the avatar of a user.

The function takes in an UploadFile object, which contains the file that will be uploaded to Cloudinary. It also takes in a User object, which is obtained from the token_service module’s get_current_user function. Finally it takes in a Session object, which is obtained from the get_db function defined above.

Parameters:

  • file – UploadFile: Upload the file to cloudinary

  • current_user – User: Get the current user’s email

  • db – Session: Create a connection to the database

Returns:

A user object with the updated avatar url

Doc-author:

Trelent

GoIT-RestAPI service Auth¶

class src.services.auth.Info¶

Bases: object

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
SECRET = 'secret_key'¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
class src.services.auth.Password¶

Bases: Info

hash_password(password: str) → str¶

The hash_password function takes a password as an argument and returns the hashed version of that password. The hash_password function uses the pwd_context object to generate a hash from the provided password.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • password – str: Pass the password to be hashed

Returns:

A string

Doc-author:

Trelent

verify_password(password: str, hashed_password: str) → bool¶

The verify_password function takes a plain-text password and a hashed password and returns True if the passwords match, False otherwise. The function uses the passlib library to verify that the hash matches what is stored in our database.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • password – str: Store the password that is passed in from the user

  • hashed_password – str: Pass in the hashed password from the database

Returns:

A boolean value, true if the password is correct and false otherwise

Doc-author:

Trelent

class src.services.auth.Token¶

Bases: Info

async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None) → str¶
The create_access_token function creates a new access token for the user.
Args:

data (dict): A dictionary containing the user’s information. expires_delta (Optional[float]): The time in hours until the token expires. Defaults to 10 hours if not specified.

Parameters:

  • self – Refer to the class itself

  • data – dict: Pass the data that will be encoded in the jwt

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the time that the access token expires

Returns:

A string that is the encoded access token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async create_email_token(data: dict)¶

The create_email_token function takes a dictionary of data and returns a JWT token. The token is encoded with the SECRET key, which is stored in the .env file. The algorithm used to encode the token is also stored in the .env file.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass the data that needs to be encoded

Returns:

A token, which is a string

Doc-author:

Trelent

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None) → str¶
The create_refresh_token function creates a refresh token for the user.
Args:

data (dict): A dictionary containing the user’s id and username. expires_delta (Optional[float]): The number of hours until the refresh token expires. Defaults to None, which sets it to 10 days from creation time.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass in the user’s id, username and email

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiry time of the token

Returns:

A string

Doc-author:

Trelent

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str) → str¶

The decode_refresh_token function is used to decode the refresh token. It takes a refresh_token as an argument and returns the email of the user who owns that token. If it fails, it raises an HTTPException with status code 401 (UNAUTHORIZED) and detail message ‘Could not validate credentials’.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • refresh_token – str: Pass in the refresh token

Returns:

The email of the user who is trying to refresh their token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_current_user function is a dependency that will be used in the

protected endpoints. It takes a token as an argument and verifies it against our secret key. If the token is valid, we decode it to get its payload, which contains information about the user who made this request (such as their email).

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of a class

  • token – str: Get the token from the request header

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A user object, which is defined in the models

Doc-author:

Trelent

async get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

The get_email_from_token function takes a token as an argument and returns the email address associated with that token. The function uses the jwt library to decode the token, which is then used to return the email address.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • token – str: Pass in the token that is sent to the user’s email

Returns:

The email address of the user who is trying to verify their account

Doc-author:

Trelent

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶

GoIT-RestAPI service Email¶

async src.services.email.send_email_confirmation(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶

The send_email_confirmation function sends an email to the user with a link that they can click on to confirm their email address. The token_verification variable is used to create a JWT token for the user’s email address, which will be sent in the confirmation link. The message variable contains all of the information needed for sending an HTML-formatted message using FastMail’s send_message function.

Parameters:

  • email – EmailStr: Specify the email address of the recipient

  • username – str: Pass the username of the user that is registering

  • host – str: Create the link to the email confirmation page

Returns:

A coroutine, which is a special type of object that can be used with

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.services.email.send_email_reset(email: EmailStr, new_password: str)¶
The send_email_reset function sends an email to the user with a new password.
Args:

email (str): The user’s email address. new_password (str): A randomly generated password for the user.

Parameters:

  • email – EmailStr: Specify the email address of the user

  • new_password – str: Pass the new password to the template

Returns:

A coroutine object

Doc-author:

Trelent
